ราคา Bitcoin อยู่ที่ระดับต่ำสุดในรอบเกินหนึ่งปี — ลาก MSTR, COIN และหุ้นคริปโตอื่นๆ ตกตามด้วย

Bitcoin price hits lowest in over a year — bringing MSTR, COIN, and other crypto stocks with it

2d ago//Mathew Di Salvo
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

Bitcoin ร่วงลงไปที่ระดับต่ำสุดนับตั้งแต่เดือนพฤศจิกายน 2024 โดยเคยดิ่งผ่านระดับ $72,000 และราคาลดลงเกือบ 19% ในช่วงสัปดาห์ที่ผ่านมา การปรับตัวลงครั้งใหญ่นี้ได้ส่งผลให้หุ้น crypto รายใหญ่ตามร่วงลงไปด้วย อาทิ Strategy และ Coinbase ที่ราคาหุ้นพุ่งลงอย่างหนัก นักวิเคราะห์ตลาดยังคงแบ่งออกเป็นสองฝักว่าภาคส่วนนี้ได้เข้าสู่ bear market อย่างเป็นทางการหรือไม่ ในขณะที่การขายทิ้งนี้สัมพันธ์กับความผันผวนที่เพิ่มขึ้นในตลาดหุ้นเทคโนโลยีของสหรัฐ ความตกต่ำครั้งนี้ส่งผลกระทบอย่างรุนแรงต่อบริษัท Bitcoin mining ที่หันมาให้บริการทรัพยากรสำหรับ AI เช่น Core Scientific และ IREN ซึ่งราคาหุ้นร่วงลงไป 9% และ 17% ตามลำดับ สำหรับ Strategy ซึ่งเป็นผู้ถือครอง Bitcoin รายใหญ่ ราคาหุ้นร่วงลงกว่า 5% ในวันเดียวและใกล้ 70% ในรอบ 6 เดือนก่อนการรายงานผลประกอบการ ความวุ่นวายในตลาดนี้บ่งชี้ว่ามีความสัมพันธ์เชิงบวกที่กลับมาแข็งแรงระหว่าง crypto และหุ้นในสหรัฐ

EN

Bitcoin fell to its lowest level since November 2024, briefly dipping below $72,000, and has lost nearly 19% of its value over the past week. This sharp decline has dragged down major crypto stocks, with Strategy and Coinbase both suffering significant losses. Market analysts are currently divided on whether the sector has officially entered a bear market, as the sell-off correlates with increased volatility in US tech equities. The downturn has severely impacted Bitcoin mining companies that have pivoted to AI computing, such as Core Scientific and IREN, which saw their stocks drop by 9% and 17% respectively. Strategy, a major Bitcoin holder, saw its stock plummet over 5% on the day and nearly 70% over the last six months ahead of its earnings report. The market turbulence suggests a renewed positive correlation between crypto and broader US equities.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin dropped to its lowest level since November 2024, shedding nearly 19% in value over the past week.
  • Major crypto stocks plunged, with Strategy down over 5% and Coinbase dropping more than 7% amid a broad market sell-off.
  • Bitcoin miners pivoting to AI, like Core Scientific and IREN, faced heavy losses as correlation with US equities returned.

Article

Bitcoin dropped to its lowest level since November 2024 on Wednesday. Top crypto stocks also plunged. Analysts are divided over whether crypto is in a bear market. The price of Bitcoin hit its lowest price in over a year on Wednesday, dragging the price of top crypto stocks with it. Bitcoin was recently trading at around $73,013 after dipping by more than 3% over a 24-hour period, according to CoinGecko data. It dropped under $72,000 earlier on Wednesday — its lowest price since November 2024. Over the past week, the leading digital asset has shed nearly 19% of its value. The drop comes as markets across the board sell-off and market observers are divided on whether crypto is now in a bear market. Cascading effect Bitcoin’s selloff wasn’t contained to digital coins and tokens — major companies in the space are down badly today, too, with Bitcoin treasury Strategy nosediving more than 5% on Wednesday. All eyes are on the pioneer of the treasury trade as Michael Saylor will share his company’s earnings on Thursday. Strategy’s Nasdaq-listed stock is down over 23% the past month, and nearly 70% in the past six months. America’s biggest crypto exchange, Coinbase, also took a hit Wednesday, and was trading more than 7% lower, closing Wednesday priced at nearly $169 a share. Meanwhile, USDC issuer Circle, which trades on the New York Stock Exchange, was trading 2% lower, at $55, and trading platform Robinhood took a harder hit — it’s down 8% over the past day. It finished the day at close to $81. The selloff in top crypto equities comes as crypto markets follow tech equities, which have experienced increased volatility over the past week. “It feels like the correlation between crypto and US equities is turning positive again as they sell off simultaneously,” Aurelie Barthere, principal research analyst at Nansen, told DL News . Bitcoin mining selloff Bitcoin miners also got slammed by the downturn. Publicly traded companies that recently have made the move to providing high-powered computing resources for the artificial intelligence industry dropped further. HUT 8 closed the day 8% lower; Core Scientific dipped by nearly 9%. Mara Holdings’ stock also dropped by 9% and IREN finished the day 17% lower. Many top companies in the Bitcoin mining space have pivoted to providing resources to the AI industry as minting coins gets tougher. Mathew Di Salvo is a news correspondent with DL News. Got a tip? Email at mdisalvo@dlnews.com . Related Topics
